text: Benno Hans Möhlmann (born 1 August 1954) is a German retired football player and manager. He played for Preußen Münster, Werder Bremen, and Hamburger SV. ==Playing career== Möhlmann began his senior career in 1972 as a midfielder with Preußen Münster in third tier Regionalliga. In 1978, he transferred to Werder Bremen in the Bundesliga. He stayed with Bremen until 1987 when he moved to Hamburger SV, finishing his playing career in 1989. In total, Möhlmann played in 255 Bundesliga matches, scoring 35 goals. ==Managerial statistics== Team From To Record Hamburger SV 23 September 1992 5 October 1995 Eintracht Braunschweig 1 July 1995 30 June 1997 Greuther Fürth 15 October 1997 21 October 2000 Arminia Bielefeld 23 October 2000 17 February 2004 Greuther Fürth 17 February 2004 30 June 2007 Eintracht Braunschweig 1 July 2007 12 May 2008 Greuther Fürth 27 May 2008 20 December 2009 FC Ingolstadt 7 November 2010 9 November 2011 FSV Frankfurt 21 December 2011 18 May 2015 1860 Munich 6 October 2015 19 April 2016 Preußen Münster 15 October 2016 10 December 2017 Total — ==Honours== *Bundesliga runner-up: 1982–83, 1984–85 and 1985–86 *UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship runner-up: 1982 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Benno Möhlmann Interview Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:German footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:German football managers Category:Bundesliga managers Category:Arminia Bielefeld managers Category:Eintracht Braunschweig managers Category:Hamburger SV managers Category:SC Preußen Münster managers
title: Benno Möhlmann
